sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The Whole book of Psalms: collected into English metre, by Thomas Sternhold, John Hopkins, and others. ; Set forth and allowed to be sung in all churches, of all the people together, before and after morning and evening prayer; and also before and after sermons; and moreover in private houses for godly solace and comfort: laying apart all ungodly songs and ballads; which tend only to the nourishing of vice, and corrupting of youth. Sternhold, Thomas, d. 1549. Hopkins, John, d. 1570.
[2], 84, [10] p.
Printed by J.M. for the Company of Stationers, London : 1668.
Includes index. "A forme of prayer to be used in private houses every morning and evening" has caption title, continuous pagination and register. Copy at reel 1902:4c bound following the Bible (Wing 2nd ed., 1994) B2276, and an unidentified edition of the Book of Common Prayer. Reproductions of the originals in the British Library (reel 1585:6) and British and Foreign Bible Society (reel 1902:4c).
=======
The Whole book of Psalms: collected into English metre, by Thomas Sternhold, John Hopkins, and others. ; Set forth and allowed to be sung in all churches, of all the people together, before and after morning and evening prayer; and also before and after sermons; and moreover in private houses for godly solace and comfort: laying apart all ungodly songs and ballads; which tend only to the nourishing of vice, and corrupting of youth. Sternhold, Thomas, d. 1549. Hopkins, John, d. 1570.
[2], 84, [10] p.
Printed by J.M. for the Company of Stationers, London : 1668.
Includes index. "A forme of prayer to be used in private houses every morning and evening" has caption title, continuous pagination and register. Copy at reel 1902:4c bound following the Bible (Wing 2nd ed., 1994) B2276, and an unidentified edition of the Book of Common Prayer.
